item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: websiteadmin
item.content:encoded:
We invite you to relax and unwind, have a break and leave your stress behind!

caravans • Motorhomes • privately owned holiday homes

Join Our Newsletter

WE ARE OPEN FROM MARCH 1st - January 2nd

Welcome to
Lamb Cottage Caravan Park

Set in 7½ acres of meticulously maintained lawns and landscaped grounds.

We are situated in the heart of the lovely Vale Royal area of Cheshire. Although easily accessible, our rural setting surrounded by farmland and away from main roads together with our child-free policy make it an ideal place for a relaxing break.

Award winning park Exclusively for adults

Meticulously maintained and landscaped grounds

Immaculate facilities for the most discerning guests

Easily accessible location within easy reach of Chester

In the heart of Cheshire “The Garden County” which is bordered by North Wales to the West and the Peak district to the East.

Touring park for caravans, and motorhomes  open March to January 2nd (Please check exact dates )

Seasonal touring pitches occasionally available

Luxury static caravans for private ownership, 10 months season March to December inclusive

on-site woodland dog walk
Lamb Cottage In Spring

A DOG WALKERS PARADISE
IN THE HEART OF CHESHIRE

We are very proud of our five star, luxury facilities

The ultra -modern, centrally heated amenity building incorporates luxury "en-suite" style shower rooms (with shower, toilet and washbasin in each) and additional separate toilets & handbasins all fitted to an exceptionally high standard to suit the most discerning guests

Free hot water and showers

Fully Fitted Laundry

Free hairdryers and shaver points

Dishwashing and veg. prep area

Full disabled suite

Dog Walking Area

Other facilities include:

Electric hook-ups • MV Service point with drive over WDP
Chemical toilet disposal point
Information centre with library
Payphone
Small on-site woodland dog walk (further off-site walking in Forestry Commission across the road)

Property For Sale

2 bedroom house for sale

View In Detail

£160,000

With two reception rooms, this is a generously proportioned home and the master suite is particularly impressive, having a dressing area and an en suite shower room.

Recent Customer Reviews

LEAVE FACEBOOK REVIEW VIEW TRIP ADVISOR REVIEWS

Recent Customer Reviews

LEAVE REVIEW

AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT
BOOK EARLY

PLAN A VISIT

Lamb Cottage Caravan Park - Award Winning Park Exclusively For Adults

A peaceful retreat in the heart of Cheshire - Exclusively for Adults. Set in 7½ acres of meticulously maintained lawns and landscaped grounds. We have holiday homes and fully residential homes for private ownership!

item.title: Get in touch
item.dc:creator: websiteadmin
item.content:encoded:
Get in touch
with us

FIND US

Lamb Cottage Caravan Park 
Dalefords Lane 
Whitegate 
Nr. Northwich 
Cheshire, CW8 2BN

CALL US

01606 882 302

Email Us

info@lambcottage.co.uk

Fill the form to reach us

[fc id='2'][/fc]

SERVICE HOURS

Please schedule to arrive between:
1:00pm — 6:00pm

We welcome arrivals any time from 1.00pm onwards and try to greet everyone personally up to 6.00pm (8.00pm on Fridays) For your convenience you are welcome to arrive up to 8.00pm any day. Please call ahead if you are expecting to be delayed.

WINTER SHUTDOWN

The park is closed from::

2nd Jan-28th February Inclusive

01606 882 302

Call Us With Any Queries

item.title: About Us
item.dc:creator: websiteadmin
item.content:encoded:
Set in 7 1/2 acres, we are situated in the heart of the lovely Vale Royal area of Cheshire. Although easily accessible, our rural setting surrounded by farmland and away from main roads together with our child-free policy make it an ideal place for a relaxing break.

Within our touring park we accept Caravans, Motorhomes and offer 

  • 41 Super pitches – fully serviced with 16 Amp electric, water and grey waste drain. Hardstanding for car, caravan & awning with lawned area to each side.
  • 30 Seasonal pitches – all fully serviced super pitches and including free winter storage if renewing for the next season.

We pride ourselves in providing excellent pitches in peaceful surroundings with immaculate facilities.

 

Our awards include 

* AA Campsite of the Year Past Regional Winner

* AA gold pennant award 2016,2017,2018 , 2019 & 2020

* Visit England September 2016 award

  • Visit Britain 5 star grading,
  • AA 5 pennants
  • Top 100 award
  • Tranquil Parks members

As we are a small owner managed park and not a big commercial or club site, we are unable to provide a shop on site and have limited office opening hours during quiet times. This is to allow us to do all the other jobs needed to ensure the upkeep and smooth running of the park ! However, we always have a 24hr contact number displayed on the door if you need us urgently while you are staying here.

We welcome arrivals any time from 1.00pm onwards and try to greet everyone personally up to 5.00pm (8.00pm on Fridays) 

For your convenience you are welcome to arrive up to 8.00pm any day and directions will be available on the door if we are not aroun50

item.title: How To Find Us
item.dc:creator: websiteadmin
item.content:encoded:
How To Find Us

We are very easily accessible being situated just over 1 mile off the A556 dual carriageway at Sandiway.

From M6 - Junction 19

Take A556 towards NORTHWICH. After approx. 12 miles you will see speed camera warnings as you enter Sandiway. Turn left at the Traffic lights into Dalefords Lane (sp. Winsford and Whitegate) Proceed for just over one mile, entrance on right hand side between a white house and a white bungalow - ( NB. there are two caravan parks in Dalefords Lane we are the second one- Large green signs at roadside) -please follow signs through park to arrivals bay opposite Reception.

From M56 - Junction 10 & from north on A49

Take A49 south towards Whitchurch and Tarporley. After approx. 9 miles turn left at traffic lights on to the A556. After 0.5 miles turn right at traffic lights in to Dalefords Lane. (sp. Winsford)Proceed for just over one mile, entrance on right hand side between a white house and a white bungalow - ( NB. there are two caravan parks in Dalefords Lane we are the second one- Large green signs at roadside) -please follow signs through park to arrivals bay opposite Reception.

From south on A49

Follow A49 north until approx 4 miles north of Tarporley - Turn right at traffic lights on to the A556.After 0.5 miles turn right at traffic lights in to Dalefords Lane. (sp. Winsford) Proceed for just over one mile, entrance on right hand side between a white house and a white bungalow - ( NB. there are two caravan parks in Dalefords Lane we are the second one- Large green signs at roadside) -please follow signs through park to arrivals bay opposite Reception.

Gps Location: 
West 2° 34, 834 
North 53° 13, 074

item.title: Onsite Facilities
item.dc:creator: websiteadmin
item.content:encoded:
We are very proud of our five star, luxury facilities

The ultra -modern, centrally heated amenity building incorporates luxury "en-suite" style shower rooms (with shower, toilet and washbasin in each) and additional separate toilets & handbasins all fitted to an exceptionally high standard to suit the most discerning guests

Free hot water and showers

Fully Fitted Laundry

Free hairdryers and shaver points

Dishwashing and veg. prep area

Full disabled suite

Dog Walking Area

Other facilities include:

Electric hook-ups • MV Service pointwith drive over WDP
Chemical toilet disposal point
Information centre with library
Payphone
Small on-site woodland dog walk (further off-site walking in Forestry Commission across the road)

2022 Price Tariff

2022 TARIFF
All fees are per pitch, per night
& inclusive of Free showers, Free hot water,
Free hairdryers and Free Wi-Fi !!

SUPER PITCH
(double hard standing,full serviced pitch with 16A electric, drinking water tap & grey waste water drain) inc of car, caravan ( or motorhome) and 2 adults.  AWNINGS FREE

STANDARD

£35.00

£40.00

BANK HOLIDAYS

£40.00

DOGS (max 2 unless by prior arrangement) Fee per dog

5th september to 22nd december

,/span.
=

PEAK SEASON
Price: £40.00
1st June to 4th september

 

BANK HOLIDAYS

15th APRIL to 18th april
29th april to 2nd may
2nd june to 6th june
29th august - 31st august
23rd DECEMBER - 2nd JANUARY
ALL DATES INCLUSIVE
Easter - min 4 nts
Other Bank Holiday - min 3 nts

Please See Our CONDITIONS OF BOOKING HERE

item.title: Access Statement
item.dc:creator: websiteadmin
item.content:encoded:
In order for you to make an informed choice as to the suitability of our park for your needs, please find the following details;

General

Roadways, most paths and all hard standing areas of pitches have a gravel surface. All other areas are grassed and the park is mostly level.

Electric hook up points are 16amps.

There is a telephone kiosk adjacent to the Reception steps.

Mobile telephone reception is very good on Vodafone but can be a little patchy other networks.

Wi-Fi Internet access is available.

TV reception is generally good.

Lighting is mostly low level and is operational between dusk and dawn.

Reception

Our Reception Office is approached by five equally spaced, paved steps with handrails to both sides.

There is a bell at the base of the steps to ring for attention if necessary.

A table and chairs is provided within the Reception area.

Park Information sheets are available in large print by request.

The office does not have set opening hours but a 24hr contact number is always displayed.

Pitches

All caravan pitches have electric point, water tap and grey waste drain. These pitches are gravel hard standing for car, caravan and awning and a lawned area to each.

The four Motor home pitches are level single gravel hard standing with electric point to each. Water point has a hosepipe to reach all four pitches to fill tanks and nearest waste water point is approx 10 – 20 metres from pitch.

Amenity Building

The toilet and shower facilities are situated in a raised building. There is access either by five equally spaced, paved steps with handrail or by a 1 in 12 ramp.

Entrance doors (including to disabled suite) have a threshold of approx 12cm.Some wheelchair users may find this a little difficult without assistance.

The disabled suite is a wet room with a shower, small handbasin and toilet. There are grab handles adjacent to all parts and a non slip wash stool is provided. There is also an emergency alarm with pull cord.

There is a dishwashing area with standard height sinks and worktop and also a laundry with floor standing washing machine with tumble drier above. The sink and worktop is standard height as is the drop down ironing board. Coin machines to operate these appliances are above the worktops – assistance available on request.

Information shed

Approached by a paved path and one small step. There is a map of the area together with local information regarding, doctors, hospitals, chemists and shops etc. There is also a comprehensive range of tourist information leaflets.

If you require clarification on any of the above points please do not hesitate to contact us and we will be happy to answer your questions.

item.title: Local Attractions
item.dc:creator: websiteadmin
item.content:encoded:
LOCAL ATTRACTIONS

Brand New 2021 Static Holiday Show Home arriving for Christmas –
viewings carried out following our strict Covid Precautions, please apply
for more information or a viewing via email or whilst onsite with our on
site Staff.

CHESTER XMAS MARKETS

Chester Christmas Market will be back in the heart of Chester from 16th November - 22nd December.
Shoppers are in for a magical time at Chester Christmas Market, with over 70 traditional wooden chalets situated in the heart of Chester, all wrapped around a sparkling Christmas tree.
There will be an abundance of festive treats and gifts on offer, including quality local and regional products, crafts, clothing, accessories, jewellery, unique gifts and stocking fillers which are sure to make the perfect present!

Don't forget to sample the delicious hot food and drink, including tasty mulled wine and hot chocolate; the perfect way to keep warm whilst enjoying the market.

Learn More / Bookings

ARLEY XMAS FAIRS

The Arley Hall Shopping Spectacular was set up in 1991 by a committee including Lady Ashbrook in support of local children's charities and it has continued to evolve since it began.

Today, this popular shopping Fair exhibits over 60 hand-picked stalls and attracts over 1,500 visitors to Arley Hall.

MORE INFO

Whitegate DAffodil Walk

If you love daffodils, Fairies, beautiful countryside, and a lovely day out, then come along to The Whitegate Daffodil Farm Open days. Enjoy a guided daffodil walk near the village of Whitegate, in the heart of the Vale Royal, Cheshire with all proceeds to Macmillan Cancer Support.

Learn More / Bookings

RHS Flower SHow

A fabulous day out bursting with colourful gardening inspiration, fun family activities, have-a-go workshops and boutique shopping.

There is ample parking within the grounds of Tatton Park, free of charge. You will be directed to an appropriate car park on arrival. All car parks are open from 8am, and close one hour after the show closes. Shuttle buses, some with wheelchair access, are available where appropriate to assist in transport from the car parks to the showground entrances.

Limited Premium Parking, closer to the show entrance, is available for £8.00 which you can purchase along with your show ticket.

Parking on the roads around the showground is strictly prohibited

Buy Tickets

Storyhouse Chester

Storyhouse is one of the UK’s foremost cultural charities, its home in Chester incorporates a library, theatres and a cinema.

It is one of the country’s most successful arts buildings, with more than one million customer visits each year. The pioneering new library within Storyhouse, where members of the community work alongside city librarians, boasts the longest opening hours of any UK public library and is open every day until 11pm. It runs over 2,000 sessions a year for marginalised communities.

Learn More / Bookings

OTHER LOCAL ATTRACTIONS

Royal Cheshire Show

For 180 years, the Cheshire show has been the premier summertime agricultural event in the North West of England. In 2016 we reached an exciting milestone in our rich history when the honour of ‘Royal’ status was bestowed on the show by the Cabinet Office and 2018 marked the 180th anniversary of The Cheshire Agricultural Society.

With its roots firmly embedded in farming, the Cheshire show holds many competition classes for cattle, sheep, pigs and dairy goats. Hundreds of classes are also included for light and heavy horses, show jumping, rare breeds of livestock, poultry, pygmy goats, pigeons, cavies, rabbits and dog show.

If you want to experience and celebrate all that is great and good about the countryside then The Royal Cheshire County Show is the only place to be, as it brings together the many interesting and fascinating aspects of farming and rural life in the beautiful and unique county of Cheshire.

Tickets/Website

Beeston Castle

Beeston Castle is one of the most dramatic ruins in the English landscape. Built by Ranulf, 6th Earl of Chester, in the 1220s, the castle incorporates the banks and ditches of an Iron Age hillfort. Henry III seized the castle in 1237 and it remained in royal ownership until the 16th century.

In the Civil War it withstood a long siege in 1644–5, before being surrendered by the Royalists and partially demolished.

Learn More / Bookings

Chester Food & Drink Festival

28th-30th August 2021

Famous faces and Fabulous Food!

Get excited for the 2021 Taste Cheshire Food and Drink festival, set at the award winning Chester Racecourse! The organisers have signed up one of the highest profile group of Chefs yet to grace the hobs on the stage.

Festival organiser, Briony Wilson says “Our aim was to bring the best chefs at every level to the festival in 2021 and I am absolutely delighted with the line-up. Headlining the event are three of the biggest names on TV. No one doubts the influence that John Torode has had over the chefs of our country as he and Gregg Wallace have been hosting Masterchef now since 2005. Gregg has been at our event for 2 years and we always wanted to get John as well and this year we have succeeded. John can be seen on Monday the 30thAugust.  

Tickets/Website

For 180 years, the Cheshire show has been the premier summertime agricultural event in the North West of England. In 2016 we reached an exciting milestone in our rich history when the honour of \u2018Royal\u2019 status was bestowed on the show by the Cabinet Office and 2018 marked the 180th anniversary of The Cheshire Agricultural Society.<\/p>

With its roots firmly embedded in farming, the Cheshire show holds many competition classes for cattle, sheep, pigs and dairy goats. Hundreds of classes are also included for light and heavy horses, show jumping, rare breeds of livestock, poultry, pygmy goats, pigeons, cavies, rabbits and dog show.<\/p>

If you want to experience and celebrate all that is great and good about the countryside then The Royal Cheshire County Show is the only place to be, as it brings together the many interesting and fascinating aspects of farming and rural life in the beautiful and unique county of Cheshire.<\/p>","_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"10","right":"10","bottom":"10","left":"10","isLinked":true},"_border_border":"dotted","_border_width":{"unit":"px","top":"4","right":"4","bottom":"4","left":"4","isLinked":true},"_border_color":"#ffffff","ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"8f3d260"}],"ekit_adv_tooltip_content":"Tooltip Beeston Castle is one of the most dramatic ruins in the English landscape. Built by Ranulf, 6th Earl of Chester, in the 1220s, the castle incorporates the banks and ditches of an Iron Age hillfort. Henry III seized the castle in 1237 and it remained in royal ownership until the 16th century.<\/p>

In the Civil War it withstood a long siege in 1644\u20135, before being surrendered by the Royalists and partially demolished.<\/p>","_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"10","right":"10","bottom":"10","left":"10","isLinked":true},"_border_border":"dotted","_border_width":{"unit":"px","top":"4","right":"4","bottom":"4","left":"4","isLinked":true},"_border_color":"#ffffff","text_color":"#FFFFFF","ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"a23027f"}],"ekit_adv_tooltip_content":"Tooltip Famous faces and Fabulous Food!<\/p>

Get excited for the 2021 Taste Cheshire Food and Drink festival, set at the award winning Chester Racecourse! The organisers have signed up one of the highest profile group of Chefs yet to grace the hobs on the stage.<\/p>

Festival organiser, Briony Wilson says \u201cOur aim was to bring the best chefs at every level to the festival in 2021 and I am absolutely delighted with the line-up. Headlining the event are three of the biggest names on TV. No one doubts the influence that John Torode has had over the chefs of our country as he and Gregg Wallace have been hosting Masterchef now since 2005. Gregg has been at our event for 2 years and we always wanted to get John as well and this year we have succeeded. John can be seen on Monday the 30th<\/sup>August. \u00a0<\/p>","_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"10","right":"10","bottom":"10","left":"10","isLinked":true},"_border_border":"dotted","_border_width":{"unit":"px","top":"4","right":"4","bottom":"4","left":"4","isLinked":true},"_border_color":"#ffffff","ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"8f3d260"}],"ekit_adv_tooltip_content":"Tooltip Content."},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"},{"id":"db0dda7","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"Tickets\/Website","link":{"url":"https:\/\/tickets.chesterfoodanddrink.co.uk\/","is_external":"on","nofollow":""},"align":"center","size":"xl","button_text_color":"#ffffff","background_color":"#000000","ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"5e7d512"}],"ekit_adv_tooltip_content":"Tooltip Content."},"elements":[],"widgetType":"button"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false},{"id":"1cead65d","elType":"section","settings":{"structure":"30","background_background":"classic","background_color":"#ffffff","ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"334eb08"}],"ekit_section_parallax_multi_items":[]},"elements":[{"id":"6a204acc","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":33,"_inline_size":null,"content_position":"center","ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"6d061db"}]},"elements":[{"id":"446b3793","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"url":"https:\/\/lambcottage.co.uk\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/Blue-Planet-logo.gif","id":698},"image_size":"full","link_to":"custom","link":{"url":"https:\/\/www.blueplanetaquarium.com\/","is_external":"on","nofollow":""},"ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"db6464e"}],"ekit_adv_tooltip_content":"Tooltip Content."},"elements":[],"widgetType":"image"}],"isInner":true},{"id":"6c45f411","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":33,"_inline_size":null,"content_position":"center","background_background":"classic","background_position":"center center","ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"f7fe49d"}]},"elements":[{"id":"24417fcd","elType":"widget","settings":{"editor":"

item.title: Conditions
item.dc:creator: websiteadmin
item.content:encoded:
PARK RULES & CONDITIONS OF BOOKING

please retain for your information

All bookings are accepted subject to the following conditions:

Adults Only
The park is exclusively for Adults over 18 years of age. No-one under this age is allowed on the park

Booking Terms
A £30.00 non-refundable deposit (£60.00 for Bank Holidays) is required for ALL bookings. Balance payable on arrival.
Single night bookings must be paid in full at time of booking. Minimum 4 nts booking for Easter and Christmas & New Year  and minimum 3 nts booking for other Bank Holidays.

Cancellation Policy
Deposits are strictly non-refundable, however, providing 28 days notice is given in writing by post or email, your deposit may be transferred to a new booking within 6 months of original booking. NB. The deposit cannot be transferred to another party.

Cancellation Policy – Updated 2021 due to Coronavirus:
This section in bold applies to bookings which have been made during the current Covid 19 Crisis. The virus is out of our control and we are working hard to make sure our valued customers are treated fairly whilst maintaining a business for future years. The situation is changing all of the time and we may have to close our facilities on site at short notice but allow the Park to remain open. In this case, there will be no reductions or refunds of pitch rent. If your cancellation is due to Covid 19 restrictions in your area or you have any Covid 19 symptoms, you can move your booking to another date free of charge. If we have to close the Park due to Covid 19 restrictions, we will either move your booking to another date ( prefered option ) or refund all monies paid. Please notify us of the cancellation as soon as possible and we will try our best to rebook a date to suit you. If you originally booked through Pitch Up please contact us directly to make any changes to your booking, do not rebook with them.

Arrival Times
Pitches are reserved from 1.00pm on day of arrival . Please DO NOT ARRIVE BEFORE 1.00 PM unless by prior arrangement. Very latest arrival is 8.00pm - please advise Reception if you have been delayed. We do not have a late arrivals area.

Departures
Please vacate your pitch by 12 noon on day of departure.

Dogs
Quiet, well behaved, non- aggressive dogs are accepted strictly on the following conditions ;
No fouling on the park Please clean up any “accidents” and put all dog waste in the bins provided. There is a dog walk provided and there is further walking in woodland opposite the park. Dogs are not allowed on the veranda around the toilet block. All dogs must be on a  lead around the park and must not cause a nuisance to other guests.

Day Visitors
Please inform reception if you are expecting visitors. (Maximum 2 per pitch only.) All visitors must be over 18yrs and must park in the visitors car park. Visitors must vacate the park by 9.30pm.

Smoking Policy
NO SMOKING allowed on the veranda around toilet block or in any of our buildings. Anyone contravening this rule will be asked to leave the park immediately and no refund will be given.

Awnings
Must be erected on hard standing area of pitch (except motor home pitches if allowed).

General
No commercial or lettered vehicles allowed unless by prior arrangement.
Washing of cars and caravans is not allowed (except seasonal pitch caravans which may be cleaned but strictly no hosepipes permitted)
No washing lines / rotary airers allowed. Hook-on window airers only please. There is a tumble drier available in the laundry.

BBQ's are allowed provided that they are not placed on the grass.


 The management reserve the right to refuse admission to the park or to terminate the visit of any persons whose conduct is not acceptable. No refund will be given. The park owners cannot be held liable for any loss, damage or accident to any person or property however caused.

On The Map

No commercial or lettered vehicles allowed unless by prior arrangement.
Washing of cars and caravans is not allowed (except seasonal pitch caravans which may be cleaned but strictly no hosepipes permitted)
No washing lines \/ rotary airers allowed. Hook-on window airers only please. There is a tumble drier available in the laundry.<\/p>

BBQ's are allowed provided that they are not placed on the grass.<\/b><\/p>


<\/b> The management reserve the right to refuse admission to the park or to terminate the visit of any persons whose conduct is not acceptable. No refund will be given. The park owners cannot be held liable for any loss, damage or accident to any person or property however caused.<\/p>","ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"c81cea6"}],"ekit_adv_tooltip_content":"Tooltip Content."},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false},{"id":"a51048d","elType":"section","settings":{"background_background":"gradient","background_color":"#23a455","background_color_b":"#61ce70","layout":"full_width","ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"cabdbcb"}],"ekit_section_parallax_multi_items":[]},"elements":[{"id":"a3c30fa","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":100,"ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"b14c369"}]},"elements":[{"id":"ce14a04","elType":"widget","settings":{"title":"On The Map","header_size":"h4","align":"center","ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"d81a305"}],"ekit_adv_tooltip_content":"Tooltip Content."},"elements":[],"widgetType":"heading"},{"id":"2bbc753","elType":"widget","settings":{"wp":{"map_center":"CW8 2BN","api_key_section":{"api_key":"AIzaSyAFrO2HarurrrJrM5lZx9_LGvgFWPhJjMQ","so_field_container_state":"open"},"settings":{"map_type":"interactive","width":"640","height":"480","destination_url":"","zoom":"12","scroll_zoom":"on","draggable":"on","fallback_image":"0","fallback_image_size":"full","so_field_container_state":"open"},"markers":{"marker_at_center":"on","marker_icon":"0","info_display":"click","info_multiple":"on","so_field_container_state":"closed"},"styles":{"style_method":"normal","styled_map_name":"","raw_json_map_styles":"","so_field_container_state":"open"},"directions":{"origin":"","destination":"","travel_mode":"driving","so_field_container_state":"open"},"_sow_form_id":"5a5cd11b3024f","_sow_form_timestamp":"1516032641341"},"ekit_all_conditions_list":[{"_id":"2288539"}],"ekit_adv_tooltip_content":"Tooltip Content."},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wp-widget-sow-google-map"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

item.title: Home With Video
item.dc:creator: websiteadmin
item.content:encoded:
We invite you to relax and unwind, have a break and leave your stress behind!

caravans • Motorhomes • privately owned holiday homes

View Our Video Tour

Join Our Newsletter

Welcome to
Lamb Cottage Caravan Park

Set in 7½ acres of meticulously maintained lawns and landscaped grounds.

We are situated in the heart of the lovely Vale Royal area of Cheshire. Although easily accessible, our rural setting surrounded by farmland and away from main roads together with our child-free policy make it an ideal place for a relaxing break.

Award winning park Exclusively for adults

Meticulously maintained and landscaped grounds

Immaculate facilities for the most discerning guests

Easily accessible location within easy reach of Chester

In the heart of Cheshire “The Garden County” which is bordered by North Wales to the West and the Peak district to the East.

Touring park for caravans, and motorhomes  open March to January 2nd (Please check exact dates )

Seasonal touring pitches occasionally available

Luxury static caravans for private ownership, 10 months season March to December inclusive

on-site woodland dog walk
Lamb Cottage In Spring

A DOG WALKERS PARADISE
IN THE HEART OF CHESHIRE

We are very proud of our five star, luxury facilities

The ultra -modern, centrally heated amenity building incorporates luxury "en-suite" style shower rooms (with shower, toilet and washbasin in each) and additional separate toilets & handbasins all fitted to an exceptionally high standard to suit the most discerning guests

Free hot water and showers

Fully Fitted Laundry

Free hairdryers and shaver points

Dishwashing and veg. prep area

Full disabled suite

Dog Walking Area

Other facilities include:

Electric hook-ups • MV Service point with drive over WDP
Chemical toilet disposal point
Information centre with library
Payphone
Small on-site woodland dog walk (further off-site walking in Forestry Commission across the road)

Property For Sale

Holiday Homes for Sale

View In Detail

Recent Customer Reviews

LEAVE FACEBOOK REVIEW VIEW TRIP ADVISOR REVIEWS

Avoid Disappointment
BOOK early

Plan A Visit

Lamb Cottage Caravan Park - Award Winning Park Exclusively For Adults

A peaceful retreat in the heart of Cheshire - Exclusively for Adults. Set in 7½ acres of meticulously maintained lawns and landscaped grounds. We have holiday homes and fully residential homes for private ownership!
